meanings.definition: Talking too much, especially about unimportant things.
meanings.sent1: She is the blabbier one in our group, always chatting nonstop.
meanings.sent2: The blabbier parrot in the pet store wouldn't stop squawking.
meanings.sent3: The blabbier squirrel in the park entertained us with its constant chattering.
meanings.sent4: Her blabbier nature was like a leaky faucet, words dripping endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The blabbier child at the party kept everyone entertained with their stories.

meanings.definition: To talk too much, especially about unimportant things.
meanings.sent1: He tends to blabbier when he's nervous, rambling on and on.
meanings.sent2: Please don't blabbier during the movie; I want to hear what they're saying.
meanings.sent3: The parrot seemed to blabbier on purpose, mimicking the noisy neighbors.
meanings.sent4: As the meeting went on, he felt like he was blabbier into a black hole of words.
meanings.sent5: She blabbiered excitedly about her new project, unable to contain her enthusiasm.
